HomePage.description: Choosing the right career path can be challenging, but understanding yourself is the first step towards finding a career that suits you.

contain.description: This website aims to help high school students, university students, and employees to understand themselves and choose the right career path.

featureCard1.title: High School Students
featureCard1.description: High school students can explore their interests and preferred subjects.

featureCard2.title: University Students
featureCard2.description: University students who feel like they are choosing the wrong major.

featureCard3.title: Working Professionals
featureCard3.description: Professionals who are looking to change careers but are uncertain about their current skills.

features.title: Career and Major Counseling
features.description: Get tailored guidance about careers and universities that match your personality traits.

features.title: Discover Talents
features.description: Identify your strengths and unique abilities through comprehensive testing.

features.title: Understanding Careers
features.description: Explore how different specializations translate into real-world career opportunities.

features.title: Converse with AI
features.description: Understand your strengths and unique abilities through engaging conversations with AI.

features.title: Skill Assessment Tests
features.description: Uncover your strengths and unique abilities through thorough testing.

ExpertConsultation.title: Consult with our team of experts at

Process.title: The Process of
Process.description: Choosing the right career can be challenging, but understanding yourself is the first step towards finding the career that's right for you. To take the test, please follow these four steps:

steps.description-part1: You can register to access our website using
steps.description-part5: Or can be linked to an account

steps.description-part1: To select a test type, you need to click

steps.description: You will receive a summary of your results by test type, as well as recommendations for suitable study and career options.

Testimonial.title: Testimonial
Testimonial.decision-part1: Here's what some of our users have to say about

Abbout.description: Helping high school students choose their university majors by providing them with opportunities to explore their abilities, interests, and future goals. We accomplish this mission through personality tests, interests, values, strengths, weaknesses, learning styles, and sharing knowledge from various fields.
Abbout.mission-description: Our team is committed to providing you with the guidance and support you need to make informed decisions about your future. With our website, you will have the confidence to choose the study path that matches your goals and dreams.
Abbout.vision-description: Become a trusted platform for high school students seeking guidance in choosing academic majors and managing career goals for future success.

University.description: Here you can find information about leading universities and institutes across the country, located in the provinces and in Phnom Penh. These educational institutions offer a wide range of study programs, including associate, bachelor's, master's, and doctoral degrees.

Jobs.title: With jobs that are in high demand in the market
Jobs.desc: Monitor the job market using our smart tools with data analytics to find trending jobs. We bring you the most in-demand job opportunities to help you plan for a successful future.
Jobs.not-found-1: No suitable jobs available at this time
Jobs.JobBannerCard-title: Don't know which job is right for you?
Jobs.JobBannerCard-desc: Try our assessment test and find potential careers today.

Footer.description: E-Found is a website that helps you understand yourself better and effectively seize career opportunities now and in the future.

address.text: Beoung Kork 1, Toul Kork, Phnom Penh

typeOfQuizKh.title: Select test type
typeOfQuizKh.description: Depending on the type of test you choose, you will get results on career and major that you should choose and to get to know yourself better.

introKh.title: Career
introKh.description: Choosing the right career path can be challenging, but understanding yourself is the first step towards finding the right career for you. This questionnaire is designed to help you understand your strengths, weaknesses, interests, learning style, values ​​and personality, and provide advice on careers and major to study.

howItWorksSteps.step1: Click on the emoji to indicate how much you agree with each question
howItWorksSteps.step2: After completing the test, you'll receive results with recommendations for majors and careers that suit you.

LearningStyleTest.learningStyle_intro_description: Based on this test, you will get results on how you learn, following the VARK theory created by Neil Fleming, along with career and skills recommendations.
LearningStyleTest.question_1: I understand information best when it is presented using diagrams, charts, or videos.
LearningStyleTest.question_2: Using color-coding or visual aids helps me organize and recall information.
LearningStyleTest.question_3: I learn more effectively when someone explains concepts to me verbally.
LearningStyleTest.question_4: Group discussions or talking through ideas help me grasp concepts better.
LearningStyleTest.question_5: I prefer to learn by reading detailed instructions or writing notes.
LearningStyleTest.question_6: Writing summaries or lists helps me retain new information.
LearningStyleTest.question_7: I learn best by doing hands-on activities or experiments.
LearningStyleTest.question_8: Practicing real-life examples or physically interacting with materials helps me understand better.

PersonalityTest.Personality_intro_description: Based on this type of test, you will get the results of your personality type through the MBTI (Myers-Briggs Type Indicator) developed by Carl Jung and guidance on which career path to choose.
PersonalityTest.question_1: I enjoy spending time alone to recharge my energy.
PersonalityTest.question_2: I feel more comfortable in small, intimate gatherings than in large social events.
PersonalityTest.question_3: I feel energized and motivated after interacting with a group of people.
PersonalityTest.question_4: I prefer socializing and engaging with others over spending time alone.
PersonalityTest.question_5: I focus on concrete facts and details rather than abstract ideas.
PersonalityTest.question_6: I prefer practical solutions to problems rather than relying on theories or concepts.
PersonalityTest.question_7: I often think about the future and imagine possibilities that don't yet exist.
PersonalityTest.question_8: I rely on my gut feelings or hunches when making decisions.
PersonalityTest.question_9: I prioritize logical reasoning and objective analysis when solving problems.
PersonalityTest.question_10: I find it more important to focus on fairness and consistency than on people's feelings.
PersonalityTest.question_11: I value harmony and seek to maintain positive relationships with those around me.
PersonalityTest.question_12: I consider the emotional impact of decisions on others before acting.
PersonalityTest.question_13: I prefer to have a structured plan and stick to a schedule in my daily life.
PersonalityTest.question_14: I like to make decisions quickly and avoid last-minute changes to plans.
PersonalityTest.question_15: I enjoy being flexible and spontaneous rather than following a strict plan.
PersonalityTest.question_16: I adapt easily to changes and prefer keeping my options open for as long as possible.

InterestTest.interest_intro_description: Based on this type of test, you will get results from Holland Theory notes on John Holland and the director of a specially selected profession.
InterestTest.question_1: I enjoy working with tools or machinery to solve problems.
InterestTest.question_2: I prefer doing hands-on tasks rather than working with abstract ideas.
InterestTest.question_3: I like solving complex problems that require deep thinking and research.
InterestTest.question_4: I am more interested in analyzing data and conducting experiments than in working with people.
InterestTest.question_5: I enjoy expressing myself through artistic activities like painting, writing, or music.
InterestTest.question_6: I prefer creating something new or original, like designing a website or writing a story.
InterestTest.question_7: I enjoy helping others and providing emotional support when needed.
InterestTest.question_8: I like being around people and prefer to work in a group rather than alone.
InterestTest.question_9: I enjoy persuading others to take action or to try new ideas.
InterestTest.question_10: I like taking on leadership roles and making decisions that affect others.
InterestTest.question_11: I prefer following rules and working in a structured environment.
InterestTest.question_12: I enjoy working with numbers, organizing data, and managing systems.

SkillTest.skill_intro_description: Based on this type of test, you will get results from your weaknesses of the skills needed for the current job, based on the definitions in the O * NET Database and career guidance.
SkillTest.question_1: When faced with a challenging problem, I find multiple ways to approach a solution.
SkillTest.question_2: I always evaluate different perspectives before making a decision.
SkillTest.question_3: I can easily apply mathematical concepts to everyday situations.
SkillTest.question_4: I enjoy solving scientific problems through experimentation and research.
SkillTest.question_5: I can adjust my study methods based on the subject or task at hand.
SkillTest.question_6: I frequently track my progress when working on a task or project.
SkillTest.question_7: I listen carefully to others and fully understand their point of view before responding.
SkillTest.question_8: I can easily recognize the emotional state of others based on their actions or words.
SkillTest.question_9: I often consider multiple factors before making an important decision.
SkillTest.question_10: I feel comfortable teaching or guiding others when they need help learning something new.
SkillTest.question_11: I actively seek new knowledge and skills to improve myself.
SkillTest.question_12: I am able to organize my time effectively to meet deadlines.
SkillTest.question_13: I am able to organize my thoughts clearly and logically in writing.
SkillTest.question_14: I feel confident speaking in front of groups or audiences.
SkillTest.question_15: I can understand complex reading material and summarize key points effectively.

ValueTest.value_intro_description: Based on this type of test, you will get results from your values ​​through Schwartz Value Theory developed by Shalom Schwartz and guidance on which career path to choose better.
ValueTest.question_1: I value having a flexible work schedule.
ValueTest.question_2: Maintaining a clear boundary between work and personal life is important to me.
ValueTest.question_3: Earning a high salary is a top priority for me.
ValueTest.question_4: I am willing to prioritize job security over job satisfaction.
ValueTest.question_5: I value roles that encourage innovative ideas.
ValueTest.question_6: I find routine tasks unfulfilling and prefer work that challenges my creativity.
ValueTest.question_7: I feel fulfilled when I can positively impact others' lives.
ValueTest.question_8: I prefer a job that allows me to help individuals or communities in need.
ValueTest.question_9: Continuous learning and skill development are essential to my career satisfaction.
ValueTest.question_10: I seek out challenges that allow me to grow and expand my abilities.
ValueTest.question_11: Receiving recognition for my work is important to me.
ValueTest.question_12: Achieving measurable success in my career motivates me.
ValueTest.question_13: I want my work to contribute positively to society or the environment.
ValueTest.question_14: Making a difference in the world is a key motivator for me.
ValueTest.question_15: I value the ability to make my own decisions in my work.
ValueTest.question_16: Having control over my work schedule is essential to me.
ValueTest.question_17: I prefer a stable job with predictable responsibilities.
ValueTest.question_18: Job security is more important to me than rapid career growth.
ValueTest.question_19: I enjoy working as part of a team to achieve common goals.
ValueTest.question_20: Building strong professional relationships is important to me.
ValueTest.question_21: I enjoy taking on leadership roles in group settings.
ValueTest.question_22: I value opportunities to guide and mentor others.

AllTest.allTest_intro_description: Based on this type of test, you will get results from your personality type, interest, strengths and weaknesses, values, Learning Style, and career guidance, majors to choose better.
